question.prompt: Which of the following is a tip for making the best oatmeal banana cookies?

choices.justification: The hallucinogenic effects of mold make moldy bananas more suitable for other baked goods.

choices.possibleAnswer: Overbake the cookies slightly for more chewiness.

choices.justification: Your cookies will be so delicious that they won't last three days.
choices.possibleAnswer: Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to three days.

hero.content: These cookies are a perfect blend of sweet and chewy. They are soft in the center and slightly crispy on the edges. The oats give them a hearty texture, while the banana and brown sugar add a touch of sweetness. The walnuts add a nice crunch, and the chocolate chips give them a touch of decadence.

body.content:
2 cups of oats  
1 cup of flour  
1/2 cup of brown sugar  
1/2 cup of granulated sugar  
1 teaspoon of baking soda  
1/2 teaspoon of salt  
1 cup of mashed bananas (about 2-3 bananas)  
1/2 cup of melted butter  
2 large eggs  
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract  
1 cup of chopped walnuts (optional)  
Chocolate chips (optional)

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C), and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, combine the oats, flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar, baking soda, and salt.
  3. In another bowl, mash the bananas and add the melted butter, eggs, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
  4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, and stir until combined.
  5. Fold in the chopped walnuts and chocolate chips if desired.
  6. Drop the cookie dough by heaping tablespoons onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving a little space between each cookie.
  7. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown and set.
  8. Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

• Use ripe bananas for the best flavor. The riper the banana, the sweeter the cookie.
  • If you want a chewier cookie, underbake them slightly. Remove them from the oven when they are just starting to brown on the edges.
  • Add any mix-ins you like. Chocolate chips, nuts, raisins, coconut, or dried fruit are all great options.
  • Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to three days.
